author: TheoryPatient6067
comment: Aiyo.. relax bro. Tbh the tests were designed in a way where they had varying mark allocation for harder questions. Example, a qn holds 2.5 marks (worth 5 qns) which can greatly bring down a grade if not answered well. Having 2-3 of the 2.5 marks qns wrong can bring you to a D easily…. Quite unfortunate but thats how it is. Even though it wasnt hard for us, i can understand why one with not much experience would struggle.
analysis:
```json
{
  "sentiment": "negative",
  "topics": ["academic"],
  "complaints": ["Test design with disproportionate mark allocation for difficult questions can easily lead to a lower grade.", "A few difficult questions can significantly impact the overall grade."],
  "suggestions": []
}
```
